column4: If I was to make (another) LiveCD, and I wanted XGL and non-free graphics drivers, would I be better starting with Dapper LiveCD, or ELive which detects binary drivers and upgrading the packages to a Dapper or Sid XGL environment?
or use the Kororrna live cd that has XGL allready there. :P
Yeah, I've got that and tried redoing it. OMG I can't get my head around Gentoo!
lol. SLAX is nice to twiddle with
SLAX? Slackware? More source code, but no "emerge" to do it automatically!
It's in the GNOME menu, along with a nested one if you have Xnest
I think my system is bloated if it is over 10GB
well you are a Linux Snob anyway. :P
ive been trying to clean up my hard drives honest! :P but the files just keep appearing! lol.
i know. :P  but its for research!
I had a username "f*** you bill gates" in a Windows 98 in QEmu once. I forgot that
I know. Windows 98, what was I thinking?
But you just put ClickNot in WBStartup :)
you answered the question in a way that dident answer much and gave him 2 more questions!  :) well done!!
